text: the Chinese government has called in the
US ambassador after President Trump
signed into law a bill that supports
pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong
the human rights and democracy Act
threatens Chinese and Hong Kong
officials deemed responsible for human
rights abuses in the territory with
sanctions the bill requires the State
Department to verify every year that
Hong Kong retains enough autonomy from
the rest of China it also excludes Hong
Kong from any US trade sanctions which
might be imposed on the Chinese mainland
at the same time President Trump signed
a second bill which bans the export of
crowd control munitions to police in
Hong Kong including tea gas rubber
bullets and stun guns but China has hit
back saying it will take firm
countermeasures if the US continues in
their words to interfere the Chinese
government is unwavering in its
determination it will oppose any
external forces interfering in Hong
Kong's affairs it will implement one
country two systems and it will
safeguard national sovereignty security
and development interests we advise the
United States not to act arbitrarily
otherwise China will take firm
countermeasures all consequences arising
from this must be borne by the United
States well a rather different response
from the Hong Kong protest movement this
is what the student activist Joshua Wong
had to say for US president signed on
the Hong Kong human rights and democracy
Act that's the remarkable achievement of
all the Hong Kong's
with the courage and determination of
Hong Kong as' to fight for freedom and
democracy to start the protest movement
on June it just encourage world leaders
around the world and politician aware
that it's time for them to stem of Hong
Kong but I've been speaking to across
one Steve McDonald in Beijing and I
asked him how he thought China would
react so obviously the Chinese
government is not happy and is called in
the US ambassador for the second
I'm in a week to give him a
dressing-down here in Beijing and the
message was passed on to him that the US
should change its mind and back down so
as to avoid further deteriorating the
relationship but until we can see what
these firm countermeasures are you know
it's hard to see how serious the
fallouts going to be mixed message from
President Trump as well isn't it he said
he signed this and has respect for
President Xi the people of China and the
people of Hong Kong yeah I think those
sort of the commentary out of President
Trump has left people scratching their
heads here in China on the one hand he's
saying this Xi Jinping best friend of
mine I respect him and on the other hand
he's then passing this bill or signing
off on this bill but I think he didn't
have a choice really because if he
hadn't done that Congress would have
passed past it anyway as they're able to
do because it had overwhelming support
you know the other interesting thing was
this kind of well bizarre sounding
commentary from President Trump that at
the same time that the only reason that
troops had not come from the mainland
into Hong Kong was because of a
conversation he had with Xi Jinping in
which he sort of said well you know best
friend don't do that or you'll harm the
trade war well I think you know many
people wonder whether that conversation
really took place that if it did whether
or not he said anything like that
but if you wanted to you know put a
spanner in the works in terms of the
trade war the Chinese government would
say this is just the way to do it
they're very unhappy about this move
from the US government Steve McDonald in
Hong Kong itself police are still
clearing up the Polytechnic University
and gathering evidence there the campus
was the scene of violent clashes between
police and student protesters for
several days our correspondent Nick beak
is there we're going to hear from him
about other issues in a moment but just
to see what he witnessed about a couple
of hours ago hopefully we're not in the
way but these are petrol bombs that
they're taking
'we probably for forensic examination
but they're trying to make this place
safe you could see the bow and arrow and
the petrol bombs and that really is an
indication of the work that is going on
today and we're just being moved back as
you can see from this lady and we also
heard from Nick about what he thought
was going to happen now regarding Hong
Kong and China the police are now on the
site and for the past 10 or 11 days it's
only been the protesters who have been
here holed up in one way or another at
its maximum there about a dozen
protesters we believe but now you just
see the police officers who are bagging
up evidence and although they say today
they're trying to look for any
prospective protesters who are still
here the emphasis is on health and
safety and getting people safely out of
here but at the same time I mean this is
a crime scene I guess and so that's why
some officers are collecting evidence
which could be used in prosecutions at
the know in the future at the same time
we've seen a massive stash of unused
petrol bombs being taken out of here
also we saw some bow and arrows being
carried out all the detritus and all the
weapons that the police were coming up
against in what was one of the most
dramatic and violent episodes in this
conflict which has gripped Hong Kong
over the past five or six months we saw
that many people were arrested as they
tried to escape and they were met with a
hail of rubber bullets and tear gas some
escaped others arrested there was a
suggestion last night that maybe up to
20 people could still be inside we might
see today if people are brought out
whether that actually was the case but
certainly the authorities here under a
new police chief I think will be keen to
prosecute people if they can Nick big
let's just take you live to the center
of Hong Kong because there is a
Thanksgiving rally taking place there
now local time what some minutes past
7:00 in the evening ahead of
Thanksgiving weekend in the United
States also in the light
of present Trump signing that human
rights bill supporting pro-democracy
protests in the semi autonomous
territory
